title: Connessione interrotta: potenziale rischio per la sicurezza
content:
buongiorno, da giovedi 1 settembre non riesco più a collegarmi a decine di siti. Il messaggio è: Connessione interrotta: potenziale rischio per la sicurezza. Ad esempio: Delcampe.com Fino al giorno prima non c'era mai stato nessun problema. Per alcuni siti si può avanzare ma per molti non c'è nessuna possibilità.

Ho provato con Microsoft Edge e si aprono regolarmente.

Io sono abituato a Firefox ma in queste condizioni dovrò per forza cambiare browser

spero di poter risolvere il problema con il vostro supporto

grazie e saluti
creator: matra10

title: Switched from Chrome to discover so much not working in Firefox!?!
content:
I wanted to ditch Chrome because of their planned implementation of MV3 degrading performance of ad-blockers. So Firefox is the obvious choice. But it hasn't gone well.

1) Having imported my browsing data from Chrome I have a website showing up in suggestions when I type "pl" that no matter what I do will not delete or go: planning.highpeak.gov.uk. This suggestion will not die no matter what I do. I've followed every support article I can find on deleting suggestions and it just won't go. Basically I wanted to get to a point like on Chrome where "pl" would prompt me for plex. But that URL for planning.highpeak.gov.uk which I probably visited once about 3 years refuses to die. Yes I could reinstall Firefox and not import my Chrome data but that's worse than Google's MV3 plans. To be clear, moving the cursor down and pressing delete (or shift delete, or ctrl-delete) hides the suggestion but the moment I go back to the URL box and type pl, its straight back. Even after deleted history its there!?!

2) Log out from Firefox just not working for me. I press burger menu, then my username, sign out. Doesn't sign me out. I stay signed in.

3) Trying to sync phone by QR code not working: burger menu -> my account -> Connect another device -> I'm ready to syncronize devices. Immediately shows the graphic "Pairing unsuccessful Try again". With a reload icon that does nothing.

I want to like Firefox but these issues are doing my head in
creator: rick.kelsall

title: Error 400 - Bad Request  The request could not be understood by server due to malformed syntax.
content:
For the past 8-10 days, every time I try to log-on to: https://selfservice.telkom.co.za/rococo/public/content/interstitial I click "Login" under the Mobile & Home heading and I receive the following message returned.

Bad Request The request could not be understood by server due to malformed syntax.

I have used MS EDGE browser and do not get the same problem, it log's-on OK.

As such it seems that it is a Firefox problem.
creator: brian.edge1

title: Updating removes tabs
content:
Hello

When I select Restart to update, I now get a window popping up asking if I want to stay on page. If I select 'Yes' then the FF Browser does not update

I use a tower PC with Windows 10 with FF version 104.0. (64 bit) - If I reboot, all my tabs disappear, which are there because I have memory issues and I cannot recover my tabs by going to history, as Recently closed tabs is empty

title: Login Password Protection for Firefox Desktop
content:
I'm a Firefox Desktop and Mobile phone User for Long back, very recently I understood that One important feature that is missing in firefox Desktop is the "Desktop Password protection for our Saved logins". in my Mobile I use Lockwise as a password saver, now it's discontinued, so I used to save in the Browser itself. but there the Passwords and login are protected by our biometric protection or the pic. very recently i signed in with my firefox account in College PC in Laboritory to enable the Extension like ghostery. After I did sign out... but most of my friends saw my passwords, they are very close to me so they didn't misuse that..

I wish a password protection in Firefox Desktop and After signing out all the Login password has to be deleted...
